law.catch_line: Plaintiff may designate agent to receive money.
law.text: When an execution is placed in the hands of an officer for collection, in a county in which the plaintiff does not reside, the plaintiff may, by endorsement on the execution, name an agent in the county to which the execution is directed, who may receive and receipt for the money collected.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1658.
